column4: Hello from Germany! When I start my machine, I get asked to unlock "the Keyring" so my machine can access my wpa router. ok. Then when I start a root-terminal, I get asked to unlock "the keyring 'default'". What is the difference between theses keyrings? Can I make it so I only get asked once?
Do you use the same password for login as for the keyrings?
yes
If you start the program seahorse, do you see only 1 keyring?
should i start it as root or as the user gnome runs as?
never as root
It WILL mess up your configuration when started as root.
i dont see "keyrings" in that program. I see "Passwords: login" and "Passwords: default"
those are the keyrings
so, could i combine them?
You should set the "login" one as Default and see what saved secrets you need from the "Default" one.
what do you mean with "see what saved secrets you need from the 'default' one"?
Click the little arrow besides the "Passwords: Default", there will be a list of saved secrets.
yes, i see them
its only one. "local password for user root"
now what?
There is no user root on default ubuntu (Well, there is, but the account isn't used) so you can remove that keyring altogether.
then i have to type the password everytime i start a root terminal. i have put this entry in my main-menu: gksu /usr/bin/x-terminal-emulator. thats what i use.
What ubuntu release are you on?
ups, im in my debian partition right now.
Wait, you share your /home between ubuntu and debian?
no
